channel.title: The Acolyte Version 3.0
channel.description:
The Cult's thing is converting based on class type, but why does the Invoker get Offensive and Killer classes?
This is the Acolyte v 3.0
[quote]
[color=red]**The Acolyte**[/color]
[color=red]Cult Killer[/color]
(Cannot be a Starting Cult Underling)
**Passives**
Blood of Mithras: When lynched or killed at night, the Cult Leader gains 1 use of Eradicate.
Breath of Corax: All players who are killed by Sacrifice will have their journals wiped.
**Abilities**
Inflammate: (D) (1) The Cult Leader's Eradicate will bypass death immunity tonight.
Sacrifice: (N) (3) Choose a member of the Cult. If they are attacked or tested, sacrifice your life to protect them and kill their attackers and Paladins who test them.
Hasten Death: (N) (1) If a player is bleeding, attack them tonight. Bypasses healing.
[/quote]
Would like feedback

The Cult Killer should not be the one protecting the rest of the Cult. Even the enforcer has a different type from the knight to emphasize this.

His job is killing but since raising KPN has balence issues that means his real job is making kills more consistent.

item.title: The Acolyte Version 3.0
item.dc:creator: Livicus
item.description:
The Acolyte

Cult Killer (Cannot be a starting Cult Underling)

Converts from Blue Dragon Killers

Passives

Blood Offering:
When you kill a player with Transfusion, you will bleed that night and give the Cult Leader one additional charge of Eradicate when you die because of bleed. (You may be healed.)

(If a Knight Cold Steels a Cult and there is a dead Acolyte and dead Knight, the Cult that was protected will 100% be executed the next day, so this is to avoid that, or at least give more time.)

Abilities

Hemorrhage: (1) (Day)
The Cult Leader’s next Rupture will kill someone that night, not in two nights. The player will see that they are bleeding and hemorrhaged.

The Cult Leader will be notified when Hemorrhage is activated.

Transfusion: (3) (Night)
Choose a player and protect them. Their attackers will die and you will activate Blood Offering. Bypasses night immunity.

Crimson Curse: (1) (Night)
Choose a player. If no one is currently bleeding, you will make them bleed. They will die in one night. Bypasses night immunity.

Unlikely, but this one?
